segment.source: The history of a Group Policy Object (GPO) can be displayed by double-clicking a GPO or by right-clicking a GPO and then clicking History.
segment.target: The history of a Group Policy Object (GPO) can be displayed by double-clicking a GPO or by right-clicking a GPO and then clicking History.

segment.source: It is also displayed in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) as a tab for each GPO.
segment.target: It is also displayed in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) as a tab for each GPO.

segment.source: The history provides a record of events in the lifetime of the selected GPO.
segment.target: The history provides a record of events in the lifetime of the selected GPO.

segment.source: From the History window, you can obtain a report of the settings in a version of the GPO, compare multiple versions of a GPO, or roll back to an earlier version of a GPO.
segment.target: From the History window, you can obtain a report of the settings in a version of the GPO, compare multiple versions of a GPO, or roll back to an earlier version of a GPO.

segment.source: Filtering events in the History window
segment.target: Filtering events in the History window

segment.source: The tabs within the History window filter the states in the history of the GPO.
segment.target: The tabs within the History window filter the states in the history of the GPO.

segment.source: Display all states in the history of the GPO.
segment.target: Display all states in the history of the GPO.

segment.source: Display only unique versions of the GPO checked into the archive.
segment.target: Display only unique versions of the GPO checked into the archive.

segment.source: The version deployed to the production environment, shortcuts to unique versions, and informational states are omitted from this list.
segment.target: The version deployed to the production environment, shortcuts to unique versions, and informational states are omitted from this list.

segment.source: Information is provided for each state in the history of the GPO.
segment.target: Information is provided for each state in the history of the GPO.

segment.source: Time stamp of when the action in the State column was performed.
segment.target: Time stamp of when the action in the State column was performed.

segment.source: A state in the history of the GPO.
segment.target: A state in the history of the GPO.

segment.source: The person who checked in or deployed the GPO.
segment.target: The person who checked in or deployed the GPO.

segment.source: A comment entered by the person who checked in or deployed a GPO at the time that this version was changed, useful for identifying the specifics of the version in case of the need to roll back to an earlier version.
segment.target: A comment entered by the person who checked in or deployed a GPO at the time that this version was changed, useful for identifying the specifics of the version in case of the need to roll back to an earlier version.

segment.source: Whether this version of the GPO can be deleted if the number of unique versions of each GPO retained in the archive is limited.
segment.target: Whether this version of the GPO can be deleted if the number of unique versions of each GPO retained in the archive is limited.

segment.source: You can change whether a version of a GPO can be deleted by right-clicking the GPO and then clicking Do Not Allow Deletion or Allow Deletion.
segment.target: You can change whether a version of a GPO can be deleted by right-clicking the GPO and then clicking Do Not Allow Deletion or Allow Deletion.

segment.source: Automatically generated version of the Computer Configuration part of the GPO.
segment.target: Automatically generated version of the Computer Configuration part of the GPO.

segment.source: Automatically generated version of the User Configuration part of the GPO.
segment.target: Automatically generated version of the User Configuration part of the GPO.

segment.source: The Computer Configuration and the User Configuration can be managed separately from each other.
segment.target: The Computer Configuration and the User Configuration can be managed separately from each other.

segment.source: This status shows which portions of the GPO are enabled.
segment.target: This status shows which portions of the GPO are enabled.

segment.source: For a GPO that has been imported from another forest, the original GPO name, domain, and user and date associated with the last change.
segment.target: For a GPO that has been imported from another forest, the original GPO name, domain, and user and date associated with the last change.

segment.source: The Settings and Differences buttons display reports about GPO settings for the GPO version or versions selected.
segment.target: The Settings and Differences buttons display reports about GPO settings for the GPO version or versions selected.

segment.source: Also, right-clicking a GPO version or versions provides the option to display XML-based reports.
segment.target: Also, right-clicking a GPO version or versions provides the option to display XML-based reports.

segment.source: Generate an HTML-based report displaying the settings within the selected version of the GPO.
segment.target: Generate an HTML-based report displaying the settings within the selected version of the GPO.

segment.source: Generate an HTML-based report comparing the settings within multiple selected versions of the GPO.
segment.target: Generate an HTML-based report comparing the settings within multiple selected versions of the GPO.

segment.source: Item exists with identical settings in both GPOs
segment.target: Item exists with identical settings in both GPOs

segment.source: Item exists in both GPOs, but with changed settings
segment.target: Item exists in both GPOs, but with changed settings

segment.source: Item exists only in the first GPO
segment.target: Item exists only in the first GPO

segment.source: Item exists only in the second GPO
segment.target: Item exists only in the second GPO

segment.source: For items with changed settings, the changed settings are identified when the item is expanded.
segment.target: For items with changed settings, the changed settings are identified when the item is expanded.

segment.source: The value for the attribute in each GPO is displayed in the same order that the GPOs are displayed in the report.
segment.target: The value for the attribute in each GPO is displayed in the same order that the GPOs are displayed in the report.

segment.source: Some changes to settings may cause an item to be reported as two items (one present only in the first GPO, one present only in the second), instead of one item that has changed.
segment.target: Some changes to settings may cause an item to be reported as two items (one present only in the first GPO, one present only in the second), instead of one item that has changed.
